text:
e="preserve">Earl Lewis Thomas (October 4, 1948 – July 4, 2020) was an American football wide receiver in the National Football League. He played six seasons for the Chicago Bears, the St. Louis Cardinals, and the Houston Oilers. He was born in Greenville, Texas. Between 1971 to 1976, he played for the National Football League.
Thomas died on July 4, 2020 in Houston, Texas at the age of 71.
